alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Magoffin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 11:31AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Knott, Floyd, west central Pike and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1131 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Martin, or near Prestonsburg, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Martin and Dana around 1135 AM EDT. Alphoretta, Pyramid, Aluba and Harold around 1140 AM EDT. Langley, Printer, Hueysville and Honaker around 1145 AM EDT. Hunter, Eastern, Blue Moon, Hippo and Grethel around 1150 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Drift, Bosco, Mid, Minnie, Porter Junction, Garret, Estill, Wayland, Glo, McDowell, East McDowell, Handshoe, Craynor, Betty, Orkney and Bolyn. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 14. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 13 and 20. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 17. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 30 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
